group_1.textLeft: Besides, y'know... I can't just sit around and watch!

group_1.textRight: Indeed, we've always stayed on the sidelines.

group_1.textCenter: ...But things are different now.@We're no longer just passive observers.

group_1.textLeft: We can help people, too!@I don't wanna stay in the peanut gallery!

group_1.textCenter: ...Then I'll try to help you out as best as I can...

group_1.textLeft: Woah!

group_1.textRight: These clothes...
They're disguises to help you blend in@with the dead...or something.
Who knows what they might do to you if they@see you as an enemy...
It's best to keep a low profile.
It's only a small comfort, but it should help a bit.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks a bunch!

group_1.narration: The guide assigned us the mission of going@to the world that Kureha and her companion are in,@putting these crystallized thoughts into the@lanterns of the dead, and finding out whether@they forgive those two or not.
If the latter, then we would ask the@deceased for absolution...@But there was still the question of@how we'd go about doing that.

group_1.textLeft: ...Wouldn't it be faster to give the crystals@to Kureha and Ooba...?

group_1.textRight: True; it would be a bit of a hassle for us to check@the colour and then relay the information back...
It would certainly be more efficient to let@those two do it themselves.
Particularly since the owners of the crystals@would know more about their feelings.
Except...you're all under the influence of@this place now.
Yuna and Juri might not recognize you...

group_1.textLeft: What are you implying?

group_1.textRight: This world is pretty hazy in terms of@perception and existence.
So since you're dressed up like the dead,
those two might mistake you for ghosts, too.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103650:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]You mean they'd pound our heads in?!

group_1.textRight: ...That's why I think you should make a connection@with that world at least once.
If you do that, Juri and Yuna will recognize you.

group_1.textLeft: And that connection would be...@placing the crystals.

group_1.textRight: Sorry if this is confusing.

group_1.textLeft: No, that makes sense.@To summarize, our objective is...

group_1.narration: "Get to the other side without being caught@by the dead.@Then place Miss Kureha and Miss Ooba's crystals@in the lanterns and find out if the deceased@have any desire to forgive them."
"Then, after establishing a connection@with that place, we'll ask the two who sent@the flowers to touch the lanterns so that they@can fulfill the wishes of the dead..."

group_1.textLeft: Did I cover everything?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's it.

group_1.textLeft: ...But will it work?
What makes you say that?

group_1.textRight: I don't know what's going through those two's@heads while they're on their rampage.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sure they're playin' the villain on purpose, see!
So...if they can get their feelings across@and speak clearly,
I'm sure the Magical Girls who died@will forgive 'em!

group_1.textRight: (Urara doesn't fully grasp the depths of@the sins that have been committed...)
(It makes sense that she'd be so hopeful, but...)

group_1.textLeft: (It's not going to be that simple...)
(It would be easy for me to break that to her,@but I don't think I should do it yet.)
(I wonder...@Is it soft of me to think that?)
We'll figure it out!

group_1.textRight: ...We will.
Most certainly.

group_1.textCenter: Now, I've made a path that leads that way,@so please go on ahead.
Ah, right!@And whatever you do, don't look back.
If you keep going straight, you'll get to@where you're going.

group_1.textRight: Roger that, Miss.@We'll be off on our way.

group_1.textLeft: Hang on a sec!

group_1.textRight: We can't look back.

group_1.textLeft: ...Nah, forget about it.
(The magic I felt just now...)
(...Was that Sakuya's...?)
